intro: Galium haussknechtii, commonly known as the Hausknecht's bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium haussknechtii is native to parts of Europe and is often found in temperate regions with cool, humid climates.
